keyEvents.title: First Glimpse of Water 7
keyEvents.description: The Straw Hat Pirates catch their first sight of Water 7, the magnificent city of water. They are amazed by the colorful tiered buildings and waterways that serve as roads.
keyEvents.significance: Introduction of one of the most important locations in One Piece, setting the stage for major plot developments including the Going Merry's fate, Usopp's departure, Robin's disappearance, and the revelation of CP9.

description: Water 7 is a city in Paradise known as the 'Capital of Water.' Built on stilts over the ocean with a Venice-inspired design, the city features colorful tiered buildings with distinctive architecture (tan/peach walls and red semicircular roofs). Waterways and canals serve as roads, with transportation provided by Yagara Bulls (seahorse-like fish). The city is famous throughout the world as a major hub for shipbuilding, home to the renowned Galley-La Company.
notableFeatures: Tiered architecture designed to accommodate gradual sinking
historicalSignificance: Water 7 was once in economic decline until the legendary shipwright Tom built the sea train system, revitalizing the city. Tom also constructed Gol D. Roger's ship, the Oro Jackson. The city gradually sinks over time, with new structures built atop older ones.
culturalNotes: Known for producing the world's finest ships

keyEvents.title: Meeting Kokoro and Chimney
keyEvents.description: The Straw Hats arrive at Shift Station where they meet Kokoro, the station master, and her granddaughter Chimney. Kokoro provides them with information about the sea train and Water 7.
keyEvents.significance: First location where the crew learns about Water 7 and the sea train system. Establishes Kokoro as an important supporting character who will aid the crew later.

description: Shift Station is a sea train station located near Water 7, serving as a stop for the Puffing Tom. The station is operated by Kokoro, who serves as station master, and is also home to her granddaughter Chimney and pet Gonbe. The station provides a connection point between the sea train routes and offers information to travelers about Water 7 and the surrounding area.
historicalSignificance: Part of the sea train network built by Tom, connecting Water 7 to other islands in the region.
culturalNotes: Serves as an information point for travelers heading to Water 7
